website_summaries.verdict: Unlike some other "boutique" chalk paints, this is a good commercial brand produced by a recognized leader in house and craft paints.
pros: Dries to an ultra-matte finish in only 30 minutes
Strong adhesion with minimal prep work
Available in a variety of colors
Distressing and layering are easy to accomplish
cons: Some users report yellowing over time

customer_reviews.title: Love this true white for the farmhouse look
customer_reviews.text: Love this paint, and love the color. It is definitely a true white, as others have mentioned. As with all painting projects, you'll want to make sure that you're not painting in 20 degree weather -- we picked a particularly cold weekend for this project and it definitely took 3 coats even with heavy sanding. I do like to use the spray as a top coat of paint before you seal it - gives a really nice smooth finish. Would definitely order this paint again from Amazon - it came with special clamps on the top to ensure that the paint would not bust open in transit.
customer_reviews.author: littlewren

customer_reviews.title: ... using rustoleum chalk paint & must say I've very pleased how my project looks after a few coats
customer_reviews.text: First time using rustoleum chalk paint & must say I've very pleased how my project looks after a few coats. Inexpensively transformed a few pieces of furniture. I also used the rustoleum matte clear coat when finished.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: I stained my brick fireplace!
customer_reviews.text: This paint works marvelously for staining interior brick! I researched for a long time and looked at many project reports for staining a raw brick fireplace. Finally I committed to this chalk paint and my fireplace looks better than any I have seen elsewhere. I diluted it to a half paint : half water ratio, applied one coat with a brush and worked it into holes and crevices with a sponge. Very easy to do, if surroundings are appropriately protected from the very thin splashy paint.
customer_reviews.author: maina donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Restore umbrella chalk paint is awesome!! Great price
customer_reviews.text: Restoleum chalk paint is awesome!! Great price! Great product! Great quality! This is definitely my new "go to" paint!! It had totally replaced those over priced products for sure!! I posted a few pics of items I painted using one 30oz can . Just to get an idea of how far it goes. Each piece has 2 coats of paint.
customer_reviews.author: tanya

customer_reviews.title: Great Paint
customer_reviews.text: I usually use Annie Sloan, and this laint in my opinion is just as good! I'll be ordering more colors!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: This paint goes on easily and is even easier to distress
customer_reviews.text: This paint goes on easily and is even easier to distress. Dries very matte and fast, like most chalk paints. It is, however, cheaper at Home Depot, especially with a military discount.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really beautiful chalk paint
customer_reviews.text: Really beautiful chalk paint. I painted a dark dresser and used two coats. Highly recommend this brand and the price is reasonable. Will definitely use rust-oleum again.
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie

customer_reviews.title: Making my life so much easier
customer_reviews.text: I just moved and have been refinishing a lot of furniture to match my new design. This paint has been amazing. Only has required a little elbow grease (just washing furniture clean and a light sanding) and it's ready to paint and finish! So much easier than before requiring endless sanding and preparation. I did this large dresser with just half a can of this paint and it turned out great. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Christina Gomes

customer_reviews.title: DON'T RISK IT!
customer_reviews.text: This caused my stain to pull through the chalk paint. My piece was just done with chalk paint, but once I added this top coat, all chaos broke loose. I'm a long time furniture redo-er and I've always used polycrylic. I was looking for a more matte finish.. Which this has, but at what cost?? I'm including pics of before and after and a drawer that missed a spot of the top coat that shows the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Simon

customer_reviews.title: Great Chalk Paint at a Low Price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a nice gray chalk paint to paint over the laminate IKEA doors in my living room. I have used chalk paint in the past and this works just a as good as other store brands but much cheaper. I will purchase this brand of chalk paint going forward. Note that there is a strong fume to this paint but it goes away quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: More like yellow protective coat...
customer_reviews.text: This protective coating is the worst. I spend a whole day repairing my white chalked paint furniture after this "clear" coat, turned it yellow. I had to sand all white part down until the yellow was removed. Lots of it didn't even get totally back to white. So disappointed. I used it with the Rust-oleum chalked linen white and followed directions... still failed :( I am so sad.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great Sealer!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using chalk paint on a thrift store tv stand that I planned to update. I had purchased the Rust-Oleum paint at Home Depot but they didn't have a sealer. I read online people use wax which sounded strange. I ordered the sealer from Amazon that came nicely sealed to prevent leaking due to shipping. I used the roller to apply thin and even coats. The application was easy and it dried well. The finish isn't truely matte. It as a slight eggshell finish which I am ok with as I want it protected. I took off one star due to the price being high.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Topcoat destroyed paint job, cracked paint, yellow hue
customer_reviews.text: I painted my dresser with the Serenity Blue Rust-Oleum paint and besides some obvious paintbrush lines, the color and finish looked great. However, when I applied the topcoat it ruined hours of hard work. The paint began to crack and turned my dresser into an ugly yellow color. Really wish I hadn't used the topcoat.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this chalk paint
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this chalk paint!!!! I recently used Annie Sloan chalk paint and preferred this one instead especially compared to the price. The texture and finish color is very nice. Definitely will need wax or poly. Only used one coat for this paint and 2 to 3 for Annie Sloan. Wish I knew about this before, would've saved a lot of $$...Will update if any change happens during use. Now let me go buy another color.
customer_reviews.author: Pascalita

customer_reviews.title: Nice paint and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: I used this along with antique White to update our bedroom set. I needed 2-3 coats for the full coverage effect I wanted but a little goes a long way. Very pleased with the results!
customer_reviews.author: Sue E.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great value for this product! Definitely can not find a better deal with smaller cans starting at $35. I will definitely be purchasing more! So little goes such a long way. I've done multiple furniture pieces with 2 coats and still have half a can left! Thankfully it came in without being busted like some other reviews, but I could tell that one side of the lid was beginning to come up. It really should be packaged better; either a smaller box or more padding. *Tip: For those of you saying it's not going on right, I recommend 2 or 3 coats and using a roller brush for a more clean/even finish!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first chalk paint experience. I used the Rust-Oleum Linen White to paint my furniture and bought this as my clear coat. The reviews made it sound so much easier than using wax. The Linen White chalk paint was bright white and beautiful. After putting this topcoat on it, it dulled the white down. It also showed every impaction, even though I couldn't see it just with the chalk paint. There are also some spots on the dresser drawers that have drippings, and the drippings are yellow!! I wish I could return this. I worked so hard on my furniture, and it upsets me that I put this on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Michael

customer_reviews.title: Do not use clear protective coat!
customer_reviews.text: This chalk paint has very nice, vivid color itself. I was happy after spending 5 hours painting 2 coats of paint. Let dry, and applied a thin layer clear coat from the same brand (Rust-Oleum). Bad things happened, the paint melted and you can see layers of color mixed stripes with the light white coating liquid. I have to let dry and paint all again to cover those uneven look. I believe this type of chalk paint does not compatible with their clear protective coat.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Goes on smooth and dries in minutes. I painted a small nightstand within 2 hours using 2 coats. The dresser was placed in a bedroom the same day.
customer_reviews.author: DoxieMom

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. If you order this item, only order just this item by its self. They will package it differently. It will squish anything thing else in the box and it will also be dented when it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: pat huttenga

customer_reviews.title: Multiple coats were used
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using chalk paint and after doing lots of research, I was thrilled that I wouldn't have to sand and prime my furniture. I chose this brand because of the positive reviews instead of the more expensive brands such as Annie Sloan chalk paint. Well, after 3 coats it still doesn't look good. I guess my expectations were to high since I was painting dark cherry wood to linen white. I'm going to attempt a 4th coat and put some finishing wax on it and cross my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Chalk Paint
customer_reviews.text: I used this to paint laminate bookshelves from Ikea, and a secondhand coffee table. No sanding, no primer, perfect finish! I’ve used more expensive brands (especially one that rhymes with “Mannie Poan” - that’s what I used on the turquoise legs of the table) and this is just as effective and easy to use. No real difference between the two. Excellent coverage, even over dark surfaces. Two paint-covered thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cabinets.
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this and it’s chalk paint sibling! (Purchased the Rustoleum Chalk at Home Depot but photo is of that product.) I did not sand the cabinets but I did clean them. I did 1 very thing layer of linen white paint, then I did two normal coats. (It goes on easier after first layer.) I used a can for all of my cabinets. (Has bought two) and only half a can of the sealer. Amazing product. Going to do my bathroom cabinets next, and an entry table. Recommended to my mom to do her own cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Repainting with Annie Sloan!
customer_reviews.text: Did not go on well and when it dried all you could see was brush strokes. This was after THREE coats! Tried to distress just to see if it changed anything but no. Very chalky when sanding to distress too, not like any other chalk paint I've used before if that makes sense. Thanks but not thanks, I'll stick with Annie Sloan or Dixie Belle. I've never had this problem with their paint. Wish I could give it zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany and Crystal Wright

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this paint for some time to change existing items of all kinds for a country shabby chic design. It is easy to use. Drys quickly and brushes was up easily with water. I have sealed some items with a top coat and left others unsealed. I have been able to take items and change the overall effect with a little paint. Love it and it's much easier and less expensive than replacing items in our home. It's been a lot of fun to see the change with just a little effort. The paint came quickly and the price is good. I would recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Raga

customer_reviews.title: Good clear topcoat; don't use with Rustoleum White Chalked paint.
customer_reviews.text: A bit streaky if applied with anything other than a rag or sponge. Otherwise it's a great clear coat - dries quickly and isn't sticky after it does. UPDATE: I do not recommend this for Rustoleum White Chalked paint. After a few days of having the clear coat on top, the white started to yellow heavily. I will be repainting over the clear topcoat with white, and will probably use Rustoleum clear matte spraypaint as a topcoat instead. I would have put this at one star, but I'm very satisfied with how well this topcoat works with other colors.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful silky paint
customer_reviews.text: Rust-oleum Chalked Paint is absolutely wonderful. It spreads evenly, it covers nicely, and it has a beautiful texture to it. Wait, there is no texture, which is why I really like this paint. Some chalk paints leave streaks and a brushed texture. This went on like silk and stayed silky. I ordered it because I am over an hour from the closest paint store, and it arrived in 2 days. I used it for a cheap bookcase with the stamped on wood-grain, the faux-wood did not bleed thru, and I transformed this ugly little bookcase into a beautiful doll clothes closet for myself. I would buy this brand again, and not the other brands from a big-box.
customer_reviews.author: M. Helper

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I've never been a thrift find person but.....I went for it and found this beautiful China Cabinet. I saw the vision of how I wanted it to look. Here is the before and after it was a bright turquoise color. I recreated such a beautiful piece it looks so great! I used two cans because trying to cover up turquoise was a small challenge but the chalk paint goes on so much better than regular paint. Now I want to chalk paint everything LOL #chalkpaint
customer_reviews.author: Keya

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: I used it over the Rust-Oleum chalked grey paint. It turned it noticeably yellow. I had to buy another can of paint and repaint my entire hutch and buy a new sealer. Disaster and ended up costing me double to paint the piece. Next time definitely going with with reliable Annie Sloan. It's more expensive but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Presley

customer_reviews.title: streaks and uneven finish
customer_reviews.text: I heard a lot about chalk paint and decided to give it a try on a chair. The result was extremely disappointing. the paint left a lot of streaks, no matter how I was using it. (same as the picture left by another reviewer). My chair looks like a 4-year old dumped a bucket of paint and played with a brush on it... this was the first and last time I am buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Delphine B.

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Really great top coat! Dried fast and provided adequate coverage for the desk I was painting. Used this to paint over white chalk paint and it turned out perfectly! Just remember to allow your chalk paint to dry completely first, or else this stuff will take off a little of the paint.
customer_reviews.author: Painted Claws

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I used country gray to paint over my dark wood bathroom vanity. I rubbed the vanity down with a liquid deglosser, sanded areas that were chipped, and then applied one coat of the chalk paint. So far I am very pleased. Also, the can came with 4 clips keeping it sealed, possibly in response to many reviews which said their can was leaking upon arrival?
customer_reviews.author: SoonerMom1

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the pricey custom craft store chalk paint
customer_reviews.text: I love all things chalk paint! This paint is very thick, it covers just about anything. I've just recently used it on dollar plastic pots for Mother's Day. This paint covered them without any problems. Chalk paint is easy to use, and easy to create custom looks with it. It is usually pricier than standard paints because it covers such a wide variety of things. I was very happy when Rust-Oleum picked up the chalk paint recipe and did their own. It is more affordable to then the homemade smaller company brands. While I'm sure those brands are good, I however, simply can't afford to use them. My projects look just as good next to the "Slone" painted ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: I found my perfect paint for my furniture saves!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! This is the bomb paint!! I had my doubts. I grabbed a mantle of a trash pile gave it a light sanding, by hand. Put two coats of this paint on and it looks awesome. I posted a before and after.
customer_reviews.author: T. Zelinka

customer_reviews.title: The cabinets turned out beautifully. I didn't exactly follow the directions -- I ...
customer_reviews.text: We used this over top of of the Rustoleum Chalked white paint on some unfinished cabinets. We wanted a farmhouse look for the nook where the cabinets were. The cabinets turned out beautifully. I didn't exactly follow the directions -- I applied one coat, wiped it gently, and applied a bit of water and wiped it again. This "technique" allowed for a less dark/drastic finish. It is easy to work with and easy to fix if you make a mistake. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah McRoberts

customer_reviews.title: Tends to yellow over white chalk paint
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if there is a reaction to the chalk paint or what. But we primed our built-ins with cabinet primer then used two coats of the linen white rustoleum chalk paint and this as the seal. For some reason spots yellowed when the seal was put on. My friend had the same issue in her kitchen where it yellowed on her cabinets. They contacted rustoleum and they told them to sand it down and repaint. I feel like if you are using all their products it shouldn’t react that way.
customer_reviews.author: MissMoMo

customer_reviews.title: Beware....don’t waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the product came dented. I used it anyway and hated it. I used half a can on a small night stand to get a half way decent paint job. But, I gave up on it. Every time I painted the piece streaks and blotches would come through. I tried to water it down, put it on thick, and even use a primer. But, nothing worked. It just got uglier and uglier. And, whenever I touched the dried paint a stain would appear. I would wipe it off. But, the wipe mark would cause a discoloration. This is so frustrating. I’m done with this paint. Oh, by the way, it was the gray paint.
customer_reviews.author: Gilmo676

customer_reviews.title: One can covers a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I had never used chalk paint before, but I used this to cover a desk (several coats), a kids table and four chairs (two coats), a small chalkboard rim (two coats), and a two-shelf bookcase (two coats in most places). It really goes far and now I have cute matching furniture pieces in my house. I wouldn’t recommend it for anything that you want to wipe with water, though, unless you put a protective coat over top (my kids spilled water on their table and now it has stains in spots). One can covers a lot, and I highly recommend this paint!
customer_reviews.author: New Mama

customer_reviews.title: Turned white paint yellowish
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to apply, however the end result was terrible. I painted my furniture with the Rust-Oleum Linen White Chalked paint and I liked the look until I put on the finish. It is now a yellowish color that I am not happy with at all. I did a complete bedroom suite, 5 pieces, and I don't have the energy to redo it so I am stuck with what I have.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Discovering the chalk paint craze!
customer_reviews.text: First time using chalk paint. It does everything they claim it will. No priming necessary. I painted a used bathroom sink console that was just ordinary oak. Turned it into a charming little French country cabinet. Distressed and antiqued with wax later. Not real hard to do and still have 2/3 can left. Now eyeing everything: what else can I paint! I have two occasional tables that will be getting makeovers.
customer_reviews.author: LeslieB

customer_reviews.title: Great chalk paint
customer_reviews.text: Great chalk paint! As a professional furniture restorator. I've used many different brands of chalk paint. Some high ends ones (not naming "her" name) This stuff is just as good, if not better. I just wish they had more colors.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous results
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful color!! Easy to work with and well priced. Results put a darkened edge to your “chalked” furniture you’ve painted. Make sure to use lightly if looking for an antique look. It is a great product and highly recommend. Better than others out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I have been wanted to redo my cabinets till I read using this would do the job! I just cleaned the cabinets and I went in! I did do 2-3 coats as you can see the color of before. It dries quickly. I used about 1.5 cans to do all cabinets ( 20 doors, 9 drawers, side of cabinets and some decorations I used in the kitchen. If used for items that can get dirty you will need a sealing wax for protection
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Darkens the surface
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a clear finish to put on old weathered barn board that would not darken the bare wood or yellow the remaining bits of white paint. This product darkened the wood so we did not use it. What did work was Krylon Colormaxx Clear spray paint in Flat Crystal Clear. We also tried Rustoleum Painter’s Touch 2X Ultra Cover spray paint in Matte Clear (darkened the wood) and Minwax Fast Drying Polyurethane in Clear Satin (darkened the wood and yellowed the paint).
customer_reviews.author: Carma

customer_reviews.title: First time with chalk paint.... LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE Just finished my second coat. Brushed the first coat, rolled the second. Did not add any water. Went over the old, fake oak, ugly builder cabinets nicely without priming or sanding. Wiped down and went at it. I will do a faux granite on the top after we replace facet. Then poly it with minwax till it is hard as nails. Extremely easy to work with, no odor and washes off skin, clothes etc. This is so much easier than paint and It went a long way. FYI: using the roller at the end gives it a smooth finish. This is the Linen White. A true white. Update: finished quickly and easily. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Carla O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this!! My first project inspired with all the DIY on pinterest. Everybody suggested Annie Sloan on their sites but I didn't have the time to go to specific store so just looked up on amazon for a substitute and this had best reviews. So easy as stated, no need to sand or prime. I just cleaned the surface with a good wood cleaner. Then applied 2 coats only had to wait 4-6 hours between the coats. Then did sand a bit before finishing with the minwax. Photos attached for reference
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serenity blue!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this color! I was worried what kind of blue but it's almost just as the can. This was for my daughters bed and now I may just have to paint my coffee table with this color because I love it so much. I just hope rustoleum has more colors but anyway I have bought 3 now and the top coat (works great I believe seems good) I don't like wax. This is serenity blue. Note: I'm fixing my light in the room so it's not as bright.
customer_reviews.author: No name

customer_reviews.title: Lovely paint, a little goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: I have used pretty much every chalk paint out there. What I love about this one is that it is so smooth and it has a ton of pigment, meaning a little paint goes a long way. I painted a bunch of picture frames with this and it doesn't even look like I used any. The paint has a bit of a purple hue to it. I put the picture frames in a bedroom that was painted blue, maybe that is why I saw the purple tint. The color is still very pretty but thought you might need to consider that. Will definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: shonee

customer_reviews.title: Beats Anne Sloan!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good bye Anne Sloan! This product was easier to use, consistency made it spread easily, and 1/2 the price. My project was a very dark stained hutch. Prep was s good cleaning. Then allowed to dry followed by 2 coats. So happy with the finished project. Just ordered again for another project!
customer_reviews.author: philip shaw

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a “True White” Chalk Paint? No need to look any further... This is it!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a Crafter who has always used Waverly’s Chalk Paint, sold in 8oz bottles. I stumbled upon this product while watching a YouTube DIY video and have been sold on it after the 1st project! I was hesitant at first because of the size & the name “Linen White” But both concerns were unfounded since it’s a “True White” (something which is oddly tough to find in the Craft world?) And Since White is the Color I use most in my Crafting, I did eventually find the bottom of the Can and just reordered one. Very versatile & worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Doucette

customer_reviews.title: Coastal blue  - great for kitchen cabinets
customer_reviews.text: Goes on a bit thick and will leave brush marks. For my Kitchen project I didn't mind as it developed a faux wood grain on my cabinets which was a happy accident in the end. If you want a smoother look, you need to practice/ experiment with some diluted paint mixes. Just use small amounts of water and don't let your brush get dry. The color turned out to be very nice. Better than the much more expensive blue Annie Sloan paint. I used a waterbased clear coat instead of wax so will be easy to repaint if needed. A little antiquing brought it to life. Over all happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn H

customer_reviews.title: Product is fine, Amazon's shipping was not.
customer_reviews.text: Three stars for the actual product. Zero stars for Amazon's crappy packaging. Well Amazon, y'all really missed the mark on this one. Instead of adding tape or SOMETHING to the lid to keep it on, it looks as though it was just thrown into the box and sent out. Product itself is alright. Not the best chalk paint but definitely workable. Layering ONLY after it's dry, otherwise you just pull the paint right back up. Highchair was finished in linen white
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as Annie Sloan
customer_reviews.text: I bought the linen and charcoal colors. They colors were true to description. I have painted with Annie Sloan chalk paint before and this works just as well for half the cost. And easier to find! Very matte finish, maybe more matte than Annie Sloan. If you use the white be prepared to need 3 coats for full coverage but that is pretty standard for any white paint. I only needed 2 with the charcoal. Would definitely use again. They came packaged great. One of the cans had a super small dent, but who cares.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: At only $15/can I saved a ton compared to other major brands and my entertainment center looks amazing!! I've had two people ask me if ...
customer_reviews.text: I was debating between this pain, Annie Sloan and Renaissance. Everyone says you need to make sure you get quality pain when chalk painting. Due to such a huge difference in price I decided to go with Rustoleum and I am so thankful that I did. At only $15/can I saved a ton compared to other major brands and my entertainment center looks amazing!! I've had two people ask me if I hired a professional to paint it for me. I plan on buying more of this paint for my next big project, which will be my kitchen cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Simgree

customer_reviews.title: For chalk paint only
customer_reviews.text: 1. It wasn't packaged well for shipped, I ordered two and they rolled all around and dented one another bending where I needed to open it. 2. Don't use on anything other than chalk paint....I tried and ruined a time sensitive project...the can states that it thought I'd try it, haha.... don't! The next project was over white....not sure how it would look over a color but on white it's perfect!

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIY projects
customer_reviews.text: I have used rustoleum chalked paint on numerous occasions and on all different sorts of surfaces. I will have to say it works better on wood (porous surfaces) than cement etc. So easy to use! Drips and brush marks can be easily sanded away. Clean up is a breeze too... so much nicer than latex. While the can says it is one coat, I always have to do two especially when it comes to non-porous surfaces. I tend to use this paint for fixer upper furniture and also have used it for stenciling floors. If you plan to use it for stenciling floors, it is more like 2-3 coats.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Lovely color, absorbs oils, wipes off w damp cloth
customer_reviews.text: Painted a table and chairs but this paint rubs off when wiped with damp sponge. Sponge comes away with the paint too when wiping off maple syrup or a spill. Also absorbs oil like food stains in spots and then looks very dirty and gross. Table needed to be repainted at least once a year probably to keep looking ok. Would probably be fine on decorative pieces but I don’t recommend this for a high traffic area that’s used and touched a lot unless you are then sealing the heck out of it. (I used wax after).
customer_reviews.author: GA Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: (Pics are of one coat, two coats, then after sanding/waxing.) This was my first time working with chalk paint and it wasn't too bad. I did two coats and some light sanding and touch ups. Be weary though using a wax on top as a sealer. I used Rust-Oleum finishing wax and it made the grain a lot more visible and wiped some of the paint off. It does dry less noticeable but it's one thing to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This brand is great. I refurbish furniture and have tried plenty of brands, including Annie sloan. This is a good go to brand if you want to save money. The consistency is perfect and if you use a primer before painting, one or 2 coats will do the job. If you want a super smooth finish, lightly sand your work with a very light sandpaper. That goes for any chalk paint. I painted my sons toddler bed in Country grey which has a beige tone to it, and it looks fine without sanding it. Oh and its easy to distress too.
customer_reviews.author: Justina

customer_reviews.title: Brings out impurities
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in order to "protect" my China hutch as an after coat - I chalk painted w/ the same brand chalk paint. I was hoping this would just be a protectant cover but it actually brought out all the impurities in my China Hutch and within my painting (brush strokes, etc). I ended up using the chalk paint and re-covering everything over top of this as it turned everything a yellow-ish color/tint which is not what I was going for.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Refinished an old hutch
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I used this to refinish an old hutch to look farmhouse style. It goes on easy and is thick which is nice for coverage. I wish we could find it in a one gallon size. We will buy more to do the same to our dining table and chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C

customer_reviews.title: Great company, great paint
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with my order in which the company promptly emailed me back and rectified the issue. Definitely a great company to work with. As for the paint, I used the chiffon cream color. The chalk paint was easy to use and had great coverage. I still was required to do two coats as one did not cover it. I used a primer prior to painting with the chalk paint. I definitely recommend waiting at least a good 1.5 hours to 2 hours of dry time I’m between coats otherwise, if it’s not completely dry the paint brush will actually pull the first coat up. Here are my before and after. This color was exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: Josen

customer_reviews.title: ... the moment I put this on it turned my beautiful grey entertainment center yellow
customer_reviews.text: I painted my entertainment center the ages grey and the moment I put this on it turned my beautiful grey entertainment center yellow! Now I have to rebuy the grey and start all over! I’m now paying double the cost to fix what this supposedly CLEAR coat did!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: The can arrived dented but the paint inside was fine! Although this says no priming needed
customer_reviews.text: The can arrived dented but the paint inside was fine! Although this says no priming needed, I ended up having to prime my piece anyway because the original wood stain kept bleeding through. I probably ended up doing 4 coats with one can on a large sideboard (2 before I primed, but then the stain kept coming through and then 2 after I primed - definitely some trial and error on my part). I still have a little less than a quarter of a can left. I do recommend if you are going from something really dark to white, priming would be helpful, just to seal the original piece before painting.
customer_reviews.author: annazon

customer_reviews.title: I liked this product
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I liked this product. It went on easily. It smelled really bad, so I wore a mask. I sanded my dresser lightly, used a primer, used the Chalked Paint in White Linen, then used this matte clear product. Like some others experienced, I did get some yellowing unfortunately, only in some spots though. I just sanded those spots lightly, then repainted and put the clear over and it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Emily P

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with good results
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has never repainted any furniture, I really appreciated this product. It was very easy to use, and I really only needed to use one coat and a few touch ups to get the look I wanted. I repainted an old toy chest my grandfather made for me in the early 1990s, and this grey paint covered up the bright color really well.
customer_reviews.author: EriLang

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using chalk paint and I am in love! I obviously don't have anything to compare it to as far as different brands, but I am very pleased. I used the country gray and did 2 layers then protected with water based polycrylic and so far it's holding up well (it's only been 2 weeks right now so I'll update if that changes). The price is great and the paint goes a long way (2 layers on a chest of drawers and still have half the can). 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Easy makeover, great color!
customer_reviews.text: Love this paint! No sanding or primer! Follow me on Instagram, @wifeonadime ,to see the before photo. The color is exactly what I wanted. Not too cream but not bright white. 3 coats of paint and worked well on this furniture. It was a very dark cherry brown before I painted. I did end up using the matte top coat by Rustoleum on top because the paint will scratch if you don’t. If you want a distressed look and plan to distress the furniture then you wouldn’t need a top coat.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful coverage, great color, easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a light pink chalk paint. I read many reviews and believe that Rustoleum is a superior brand to more expensive alternatives. I've had great success with the linen white, which I was able to find at Home Depot. I wanted a light pink, but the stores didn't carry it. I was afraid the color would come off too pink, but it is such a beautiful dusty pink. It looks amazing in the nursery. This chalk paint is super easy to apply, no sanding is needed, no primer is needed. I just used a few coats of this (it dries very quickly) and the ultra matte as a top coat. Cannot recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great Chalk Paint for a great Price.
customer_reviews.text: This chalk paint is awesome. I’ve used the expensive brands and have even made my own. By far this is the best for the price. I painted some mason jars. I painted two coats, used sanding block to remove paint, one coat of Polycrylic clear matte finish. Tied some jute around the top... add flowers. Cute gift or decoration for your home.
customer_reviews.author: sonnya kale

customer_reviews.title: I love chalk paint and would have given this 5 stars ...
customer_reviews.text: I love chalk paint and would have given this 5 stars except that it leaked a bit in the box on it's way here, and thank goodness it somehow managed to not get on the other things I ordered that were in the box! Seriously, I checked everything and there wasn't any paint on anything else, but it was on itself and the inner part of the box. It would have cost your company some extra money had the paint landed on anything else. Make sure these travel alone would be my advice.
customer_reviews.author: montana

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way!
customer_reviews.text: This product has great coverage. No sanding or priming is required, however I have noticed that if your wood has a glossy finish or if you are painting glass, you will likely need an extra coat as this applies much easier to matt wood. It is a phenomenal value for the price, you really can't compare it to other brands that cost twice as much (often for less product). Highly recommend and will definitely be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful vintage look
customer_reviews.text: I used this over a dresser and record stand that I had painted with white and red chalk paint. It took it from stark white and barn red to a nice vintage aged look. It goes on super dark which can be alarming, but wipes off to leave a tint of brown/copper. I just ordered the gray based glaze for my other projects! I definitely recommend ordering some lint free towels/rags to use with it. I went through about 5 of them for my 2 pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Love this paint color
customer_reviews.text: Love the color, its subtle light warm color. Just what I was expecting, Paint is great quality
customer_reviews.author: jbug

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great results
customer_reviews.text: I've never used this type of paint before but needed to paint a wooden chest (stain wasn't working out so well), so glad I used this! I ended up needing 3 coats instead of 1 (you could still see the wood underneath after 1 coat) but it dries quickly so I was still able to get this done in a couple of days. The paint is thick and really easy to use. I just wanted a clean look which is why I used 3 coats, but I could see this being very easy to distress and to give an antique type look with less coats. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: The Best Chalk Paint imo!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using rustoleum chalk paint for a year now and I absolutely love it! It took me a time or 2 to figure out that the more you brush to smooth out, the more you'll have brush strokes(good or bad depending on look your going for) but nothing a chalk brush(worth it) and spray bottle of water can't fix! My only negative would be that it's sometimes hard to find more then 2 or 3 colors in stores! Luckily I can now buy on Amazon and get the next day!
customer_reviews.author: Hsforever98

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to seal it. Cans of blue do not have matching color.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and happy with the results. Used 2 coats of the blue and 3 of white then used the sealer to achieve the look we wanted. Hopefully it will hold up. Update: Had to purchase a 2nd can of blue to complete the beadboard. You can totally tell which pieces we used the new can on. The left is the first can and the right was the new can.
customer_reviews.author: B. Zeiser

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, I nade a great decision!!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't so sure about purchasing this paint online...no sample, no swatch, no reliable preview. But I. LOVE. THIS. PAINT. Love the color (a deep, rich blue), love the texture, love the look against our blue-gray wall color. I'll just add some white updated hardware and presto!! Better than new!! Now I'm searching all over the planet to find other things to paint. Way to go, Rustoleum; you've created a great alternative to the high dollar options out there. (On a side note, I stretched further out of my comfort zone to buy a dented can offered by Amazon. Well worth it. Will do it again in a skinny minute 😆)
customer_reviews.author: Amazed by Him

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and good coverage
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cover an old steamer trunk and turn it into a coffee table. It was easy to work with and gave me really good coverage. I still have plenty left for another project. I distressed it after painting, which was very easy. I did notice some yellowing spots after applying the sealant but I believe that was due to the sealant not the chalk paint.
customer_reviews.author: RaeAn

customer_reviews.title: Kick those designer name ones to the curb!!!
customer_reviews.text: Why pay double or triple the price of this chalk paint to have a "designer" name on the can when Rustoleum, a company that has been around FOREVER, makes this one? It performs as well, if not better, than the designer ones, and the end product is gorgeous! It applies easily, dries quickly, distresses well, waxes like a dream. What more does one want???
customer_reviews.author: SteelersGal4Ever

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginner projects!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful finish, and mixes very well with other colors in its line. I mixed this and a gray color just for the fun of it to redo a used desk I got from a consignment store as my very first fixer upper project, and it gave me a stunning subtle lavender color! I sealed it with waterproof satin finish sealer to help RESIST water stains, which it does very well, and it looks beautiful as if I'd bought it new from a store, designed that way. I totally recommend this for first time projects, as the dry /cure time is perfect for those who need instant gratification with projects!
customer_reviews.author: Lavender Unicorn

customer_reviews.title: This is much cheaper than other brands of chalk paint ...
customer_reviews.text: This is much cheaper than other brands of chalk paint, such as Annie Sloan, and I actually think it goes on more smoothly and has a nicer finish.
customer_reviews.author: LilGracie

customer_reviews.title: Great Antique Look
customer_reviews.text: I painted my kitchen oak cabinets with this after much thought. I love them. The paint IS thick but very simple to use. I did not primer. Just cleaned them good with 10 grit sandpaper, rinsed with vinegar water, dried then painted. It took me two coast to achieve what I wanted. First coat will always look streaked but second gives it that chalk antique look. Minor touch up in spots after second. Always paint with the grain. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Pebbles

customer_reviews.title: Lovely color and finish!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first experience using chalk paint. I didn't realize how quickly the paint would dry. By the time I finished painting one side, the other side was dry! I also did not know that I should apply the paint and then wipe it off. No matter what, the paint looks fabulous. I love it and I would definitely use it again! I used this chalk paint (and a stain) to refinish the desk that is in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Flying By the Seat of My Pants

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I had some old antique furniture laying around the house. Decided I would try to give them a bit of an upgrade. Absolutely love this paint for this. It was perfect color exactly what I wanted. Had to use three coats on the biggest parts but it dried beautifully. Only down side is if you do not use wax it will easily chip because it is so Matte
customer_reviews.author: mh215

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to paint an old crib using this chalk paint after reading tons of blogs and reviews saying it was baby safe, and prep is quite easy. I used a 220 sand paper to lightly prep the crib, wiped the surface and proceeded to paint. I did have to use the whole can to paint the crib. Needed about 3 coats to cover all the brown underneath. I guess if I had done heavier sanding, I would have not needed as much paint. Definitely recommend, it’s a true white color.
customer_reviews.author: vero

customer_reviews.title: Expired or incorrect store conditions?
customer_reviews.text: I used to paint a furniture a week ago. I applied three coats and I still could see the primer below. Then the finish was uneven or totally irregular. When I ran out of paint I bought the same paint in the local Home Depot, same price but different label. What a difference, I applied two coats and done. Conclusion the can bought in amazon was expired or it had been stored under inconvenient conditions for this paint. Just in case I would recommend to buy in your local hardware store an avoid problems.
customer_reviews.author: Gafernan

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say stir thoroughly, no thinning required.... when I opened the can today the ingredients were separated in what I can only describe as tofu like... I’ve been stirring for half an hour and it is still chunky.... I am not sure how I will be able to use this. So disappointing. This was stored in a dry cool place out of the sun once it was delivered, never opened, and yet opening it for the first time today this is what it looks like
customer_reviews.author: laura leon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color, great quality
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this charcoal color! Very rich and bold, but because it's chalk paint, there's a soft look to it too! I used it on my old 1980's entertainment center, and it just transformed it into looking much more expensive. Also, I bought this for a little less than what Walmart sells it for, which was a pleasant surprise! Had no problems with delivery or the seller. You don't have to worry about the paint accidentally opening during the delivery because they have removable metal fasteners on top of the lid, plus it's wrapped securely in plastic. Very secure!
customer_reviews.author: Southern_chick

customer_reviews.title: Happily surprised
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The paint I used was serenity blue. The consistency was nice and easy to work with. I did use a brush specially for chaulk based paint. It took three coats to cover my China cabinet inside and out. Three coats was the whole can. I distressed it and sealed with the matte clear glaze. It was a little runny. It seems like really watered down Elmer’s glue. I will update if I have any negative things to say after we’ve used it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: T0tal Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: I'm very impressed with this paint!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I've used this paint and I'm impressed with it. It is very reasonably priced and is easy to work with. I used two coats (the second keeping my brush slightly wet for a smooth coat). A very light sanding afterwards and a coat of wax and my finished product looks great! Very smooth and durable finish. Why pay for the expensive brand chalk paints when this one does just as well? Would love a few more color options. Colors are limited. That is my only complaint!
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Looks great.  Not crazy about having to seal it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy application. Just don't like the fact that it needs to be sealed or waxed. It adds another step. Prior to the finishing, the upholstered chair i painted felt and looked great. I used midge podge fir fabric go seal it and it turned into a rubbery look and fee. Weeks later we moved and the paint came off. It was my first time painting upholstery. It looked great before the Sealing. Nedd to figure out what to do about the last step.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: You'll need a few coats but it is easy to
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using chalk paint for furniture. I scored this little chest for free. I cleaned it well with TSP substitute and then applied a coat of kilz primer. It took 3 coats of the chalk paint and then I lightly sanded in some places for a slightly distressed finish. A little coat of some antiqueing wax and some crystal knobs which I also purchased from amazon and I was done. Really love the new TV stand in my guest bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: EllieG

customer_reviews.title: Not blush
customer_reviews.text: I usually LOVE working with chalk paint but this time was a disappointment. It was thinner than usual and did not have the velvety feel when dry. However, my biggest disappointment was the color. It definitely is NOT blush. What it is, is a nice lilac color. I used it thinking that when dry it might take on a different hue, but no....still very lilac. I will have to try something else because it matches nothing else in my otherwise blush bathroom
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: The best chalk paint brand I’ve found yet!
customer_reviews.text: I updated a 70’s dining set and china cabinet using the charcoal color. The color was lighter and flat but I added a poly coat on top which made it appear darker. I used a different brand of chalk paint for the table top and comparing the two; this brand was absolutely amazing and super easy to use. One container of this was able to do the cabinet, the dining table legs and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Nich

customer_reviews.title: Strips paint
customer_reviews.text: Strips paint. Very cheap quality. Double waste of time. I ordered this because I wanted something waterproof , non toxic and liquid based sealant for my freshly repainted furniture. I used rust-oleum chalk paint and went with same brand sealant. After 2 coats of paint, I applied this and it started stripping the paint. I changed the applying technique and also with different types of synthetic brush, sponge.. nothing helped. It kept stripping the paint every time. I had to re do the entire painting again. Would NOT recommend. Will never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: NaSh

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced paint that works like a high priced chalk paint
customer_reviews.text: I build furniture and have used several of the high priced "chalk paints". This product is about half the price and does the job almost as well. The reason I gave it four stars rather than five is that it tends to be a little thick and you really need to dilute it somewhat if you want to avoid leaving brush marks. Of course on some projects that isn't an issue. Any way it is a good value, doesn't require you to prep your surface beyond making sure it is clean and grease free and adheres well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Top Coat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with the Rustoleum Chalk Paint as suggested. Horrible experience. The chalk paint itself was good. Nice color and easy to apply. I even let it dry overnight before I attempted the Matte Top Coat. Unfortunately as I applied the top coat it starting to strip away the paint!!! Very frustrating and now I have to go back and repaint all my chairs!! So now I have to buy MORE paint to redo the entire job!! Very disappointed and annoyed. Definitely would NOT recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Niavargas

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: I love this chalked paint! I was given some very old furniture that was in desperate need of some repair. I used this and some wallpaper and new handles and you can't tell that this furniture is even the same anymore! I like the matte look and I didn't have any problem with scratching or rubbing off. I only wish they had more color options so I could update more furniture!
customer_reviews.author: T Nycole T

customer_reviews.title: Getting what I pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The product is great, I have used it many times. However it was packaged terribly. Came in box with other items. Six dents in can, amazing it didn’t break open.. was going to give it in gift basket but it looks like I bought at Home Depot dented paint can sale. Very poor poor packaging
customer_reviews.author: georgia reitano

product_meta.title: Rust-Oleum 285140 Ultra Matte Interior Chalked Paint 30 oz, Linen White
product_meta.description: Color:Linen White| Pattern Name:PaintRust-Oleum Ultra matte chalked paint creates an Ultra matte finish that can be easily distressed, giving any project an unique look with a vintage feel. Rejuvenates furniture and home décor with timeless elegance.
feature_bullets: Use on a variety of interior surfaces like wood, metal, ceramic, canvas and easily distress to create a vintage look
Low-odor, latex formula allows for easy clean up with soap & water
Dries to the touch in just 30 minutes and covers up to 150 sq ft, 1-coat coverage allows projects to be completed easily
Excellent adhesion and easy application with minimal prep
Dries to an ultra-matte, creamy white finish

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars8,057 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
